intro: Ceropegia peulhorum var. breviloba, commonly known as the narrow-leafed holotype ceropegia, is a unique species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is a climbing plant characterized by its fleshy, tuberous roots and opposite, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which are adapted for specific pollinators. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
